title: (x) Burton logo - TF Alambic {Mike Y}
content:
Hello all. ![:-)](http://web.archive.org/web/20050826032624im_/http:/www.typophile.com/forums/clipart/happy.gif)   
   
Can anyone help me identify the typeface Burton Snowboards uses in their logo? It's a relativley simple sans, but the "n" is a bit unique in that it doesn't have a "tail" (sorry, not sure of the correct term) on it's left side. It's effectivley an upside-down "u".   
   
Thanks in advance! ![:-)](http://web.archive.org/web/20050826032624im_/http:/www.typophile.com/forums/clipart/happy.gif)   
   
Jeff Croft   
http;//jeffcroft.com ![Burton Logo](http://web.archive.org/web/20050826032624im_/http:/www.typophile.com/forums/messages/83/22522.jpg)
author: jcroft

comments.content:
The R looks a lot like TF Alambic (Treacyfaces). Sample from site test drive. The N could easily be a flipped U.   
 ![Alambic sample](http://web.archive.org/web/20050826032624im_/http:/www.typophile.com/forums/messages/83/22526.jpg)
Wow, thanks so much! You guys rock. ![:-)](http://web.archive.org/web/20050826032624im_/http:/www.typophile.com/forums/clipart/happy.gif)
